Food Regime and Political Economy Summar: Productivist regime with heavy subsidy and lobby support for corn, soy, beef, dairy
Common Agricultural Policy incentivizes cereals, dairy, and some environmental shifts
Export-oriented livestock and soy model; ruralista bloc politically dominant
Source Name: WRI; FAO; academic political economy literature

Food Regime and Political Economy Summar: State-supported food sovereignty model centered on rice, wheat, pulses; beef banned in most states
Key Institutional Actors: Food Corporation of India, regional governments

Food Regime and Political Economy Summar: State-capitalist model with strategic pork reserves, feed imports, rising plant-based innovation
Import-substitution policy post-2014; protectionist food regime with livestock expansion
